course overview the course on damage and loss assessment methodology aims to make information gathering on damage and loss more holistic and precise, and can be used to : assess the impact of disasters and extreme events on agriculture; provide an evidence base for disaster risk reduction/ management (drr/m) and resilience policy and action; help to monitor the achievements of specific global targets towards reducing economic loss from disasters and extreme events.
who should take this course? policy makers technical officers are ministry of disaster/ agriculture statisticians

lesson 1: need to assess disaster impact on agriculture

need to assess disaster impact on agriculture 1 lesson overview this lesson introduces the concept of disaster impact assessment in agriculture. it explains how agriculture is affected by disasters, illustrates the overall growing rate of disaster occurrence and outlines the significant share of economic losses absorbed by the agriculture sector. 25 min.

learning objectives at the end of the lesson, you will be able to: identify different disasters and extreme events; outline the different types of threat that affect agriculture; describe recent trends in disaster occurrence; compare the relative share of impact absorbed by agriculture vis-à-vis other productive sectors; and illustrate the importance of addressing information gaps on disaster impact. need to assess disaster impact on agriculture 1
